Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Monsignor Robert Thelan, Nativity of Blessed Virgin Mary, 101-41 91st Street, Ozone Park, New York 11417.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER ADDABBO.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Monsignor Robert Thelan, Nativity of Blessed Virgin Mary, 101-41 91 Street, Ozone Park, New York 11417.

Council Member Addabbo moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the re-designation of REVEREND DIANE E. LACEY-WINLEY as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on November 13, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to section 7384 of the Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the re-designation by the Council of REVEREND DIANE E. LACEY-WINLEY, as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors to serve for a the remainder of a five-year term expiring on March 20, 2004.


Res. No. ____

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE RE-DESIGNATION BY THE COUNCIL OF REVEREND DIANE E. LACEY-WINLEY AS A MEMBER OF THE  NEW YORK CITY HEALTH AND HOSPITALS CORPORATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to section 7384 of the Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York, the Council does hereby approve the re-designation of REVEREND DIANE E. LACEY-WINLEY, as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation for a term expiring on March 20, 2004.
Items.MatterName: M 375 - Reverend Diane E. Lacey-Winley, Health and Hospitals Corp.

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the designation of JOHN R. MAESE, M.D. as a member of the New York City Health and  Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on November 13, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to section 7384 of the Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the designation by the Council of JOHN R. MAESE, M.D., as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors to serve for a the remainder of a five-year term expiring on March 20, 2006.

Res. No. ____

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE RE-DESIGNATION BY THE COUNCIL OF JOHN R. MAESE AS A MEMBER OF THE  NEW YORK CITY HEALTH AND HOSPITALS CORPORATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to section 7384 of the Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York, the Council does hereby approve the re-designation of JOHN R. MAESE, as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation for a term expiring on March 20, 2006.
Items.MatterName: M 376 - John R. Maese, Health and Hospitals Corp.

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment of  MORSHED ALAM as a member of the New York City Voter Assistance Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on November 13, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to section 1054 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Council of MORSHED ALAM, as a member of the New York City Voter Assistance Commission to serve for a the remainder of a three-year term expiring on June 30, 2004.

Res. No. ____

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE COUNCIL OF MORSHED ALAM AS A MEMBER OF THE  NEW YORK CITY VOTER ASSISTANCE COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to section 1054 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment of MORSHED ALAM as a member of the New York City Voter Assistance Commission for a term expiring on June 30, 2004.
Items.MatterName: M 377 - Morshed Alam, Voter Assistance Commission

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the placement of bus stops.
Items.MatterName: Placement of bus stops.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the city and state to continue funding the City University of New York at current levels so as to avoid tuition increases, cuts to important financial aid programs such as the TAP, SEEK and College Discovery Programs, and the Peter F. Vallone Academic Scholarship program, and thus avoid unjustly balancing the city and state budgets on the backs of college students and their families, and calling upon the Mayor of New York City, the Governor of New York State, and the New York State Legislature to increase financial support for higher education, hold the line on tuition increases, and ensure the future of the CUNY senior and community colleges and educational institutions that provide a crucial and viable economic workforce and tax base for this city and state.
Items.MatterName: Urging the city and state to continue funding the City University of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring December 10 as Human Rights Day in New York City in commemoration of the adoption of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights by the United Nations on December 10, 1948.
Items.MatterName: Declaring December 10 as Human Rights Day in New York City.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the fines and penalties for illegal dumping.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the fines and penalties for illegal dumping.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to hold hearings on the safety of elevators, and especially, the sudden and unexpected opening of elevator doors that resulted in the tragic death of the youth, Dimal Suero, on June 25, 2002 at 10 Richmond Plaza in the Bronx and severe injuries to the youth, Jason Ford, on October 22, 2002 at Harry S. Truman High School in the Bronx.
Items.MatterName: Council to hold hearings on the safety of elevators.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of temporary certificates of occupancy.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of temporary certificates of occupancy.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Luis M. Beltre Place, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Luis M. Beltre Place, Borough of Manhattan.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a corner name, Rev. Dr. William A. Epps Jr. Place, Borough of Staten Island.
Items.MatterName:
Name Change, Rev. Dr. William A. Epps Jr. Place, Borough of
Staten Island.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the New York State Legislature to amend that section of the New York State General Business Law known as the Pistol and Revolver Ballistic Identification Databank Law, to require that assault weapons, rifles and other long-barreled weapons be included in New York State's ballistics fingerprint database.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Pistol and Revolver Ballistic Identification Databank Law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information regarding city contractors.
Items.MatterName: Information regarding city contractors ("re: slave trade, etc.").

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the Administrative Code of the City of New York, in relation to the acceptance of campaign contributions subsequent to the date of election from previous contributors for the purpose of debt repayment.
Items.MatterName: Acceptance of campaign contributions subsequent to the date of election.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing December 1, 2002 as "World AIDS Day" in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and Interenational Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: World AIDS Day, December 1, 2002

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature and Governor to enact Assembly A: 4199, to require all school buses to be equipped with safety belts and to require the use of safety belts on school buses.
Items.MatterName: Require all school buses to be equipped with safety belts (A.4199)

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Plaza Business College Way, Borough of Queens.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Plaza Business College Way, Borough of Queens.

Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of minimally nutritious foods and beverages at public schools.
